availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Maryland
City of Baltimore } ,ss,

Personally appeared before the undersigned a Justice of the Peace of the State of Maryland in and for the City of Baltimore Jabez D Pratt, who made oath on the Holy Evangelists of Almighty God. that he will well and truly execlute and perform all the duties of a Commissioner of Deeds for the State of Kentucky in and for the State of Maryland under and by virtue of the laws of Kentucky.

Sworn & Subscribed
this 28th day of Oct AD 1861
before me Justice as aforesaid
State of Maryland, Baltimore City, Sct:

I HEREBY CERTIFY, That Daniel E Myers Esquire, before whom the annexed affidavit was made, and who has thereunto subscribed his name, was at the time of so doing a Justice of the Peace of the State of Maryland, in and for the City of Baltimore, duly commissioned and sworn.
IN TESTIMONY WHEREOF, I hereto set my hand and affix the seal of the Superior Court of Baltimore City, this 28th day of October A. D. 1861.

p.hi: Clerk of the Superior Court of Baltimore City.

figure.ab:
THE SUPERIOR COURT OF BALTIMORE CITY.
IN THE
FIFTH JUDICIAL DISTRICT OF
MARYLAND

body.p:
Oath
J. D. Pratt
Comr of Deeds
Filed Nov 1. 1861
